query.sql: SELECT TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) AS sn_time , lc1.metric_name , ROUND( lc1.average, 2 ) "Average" FROM sys.dba_hist_sysmetric_summary lc1 , sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn WHERE lc1.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND lc1.metric_id IN (2147, 2135) -- s. v$metricname AND lc1.dbid = sn.dbid AND lc1.instance_number = sn.instance_number AND lc1.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) -- Limit snapshots to given list --AND sn.snap_id IN (&snapshotlist) -- Show only snapshots since last startup (avoid erroneous peaks in graph) --AND sn.startup_time = ( SELECT MAX(startup_time) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot ) UNION ALL SELECT TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) AS sn_time , 'CPU Count' , to_number(par.value) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn , sys.dba_hist_parameter par WHERE par.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND par.parameter_name = 'cpu_count' AND sn.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) -- Limit snapshots to given list --AND sn.snap_id IN (&snapshotlist) -- Show only snapshots since last startup (avoid erroneous peaks in graph) --AND sn.startup_time = ( SELECT MAX(startup_time) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot ) ORDER BY 1, 2

SELECT TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) AS sn_time , CASE metric_id WHEN 2123 THEN 'Average Active Sessions' ELSE lc1.metric_name END metric_name , CASE metric_id WHEN 2123 THEN ROUND( lc1.average/100, 2 ) ELSE ROUND( lc1.average, 2 ) END "Average" FROM sys.dba_hist_sysmetric_summary lc1 , sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn WHERE lc1.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND lc1.metric_id IN (2123, 2135) -- s. v$metricname AND lc1.dbid = sn.dbid AND lc1.instance_number = sn.instance_number AND lc1.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) -- Limit snapshots to given list --AND sn.snap_id IN (&snapshotlist) -- Show only snapshots since last startup (avoid erroneous peaks in graph) --AND sn.startup_time = ( SELECT MAX(startup_time) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot ) UNION ALL SELECT TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) AS sn_time , 'CPU Count' , to_number(par.value) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn , sys.dba_hist_parameter par WHERE par.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND par.parameter_name = 'cpu_count' AND sn.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) -- Limit snapshots to given list --AND sn.snap_id IN (&snapshotlist) -- Show only snapshots since last startup (avoid erroneous peaks in graph) --AND sn.startup_time = ( SELECT MAX(startup_time) FROM sys.dba_hist_snapshot ) ORDER BY sn_time, metric_name

SELECT CASE metric_name WHEN 'SQL Service Response Time' THEN 'SQL Service Response Time (s)' WHEN 'Response Time Per Txn' THEN 'Response Time Per Txn (s)' ELSE metric_name END metric_name, CASE metric_name WHEN 'SQL Service Response Time' THEN ROUND((average / 100), CASE WHEN average > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) WHEN 'Response Time Per Txn' THEN ROUND((average / 100), CASE WHEN average > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) ELSE ROUND( average, CASE WHEN average > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) END average, CASE metric_name WHEN 'SQL Service Response Time' THEN ROUND((minval / 100), CASE WHEN minval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) WHEN 'Response Time Per Txn' THEN ROUND((minval / 100), CASE WHEN minval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) ELSE ROUND( minval, CASE WHEN minval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) END mininum, CASE metric_name WHEN 'SQL Service Response Time' THEN ROUND((maxval / 100), CASE WHEN maxval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) WHEN 'Response Time Per Txn' THEN ROUND(( maxval / 100 ), CASE WHEN maxval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) ELSE ROUND( maxval, CASE WHEN maxval > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) END maximum, CASE metric_name WHEN 'SQL Service Response Time' THEN ROUND((standard_deviation / 100),2) WHEN 'Response Time Per Txn' THEN ROUND((standard_deviation / 100),2) ELSE ROUND( standard_deviation, CASE WHEN standard_deviation > 100 THEN 0 ELSE 2 END ) END standard_deviation FROM sys.dba_hist_sysmetric_summary lc1 , sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn WHERE lc1.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) = :SN_TIME AND lc1.metric_name IN ('Average Active Sessions', 'SQL Service Response Time', 'Response Time Per Txn' , 'Physical Read Total Bytes Per Sec', 'DB Block Gets Per Sec', 'Consistent Read Gets Per Sec' , 'CPU Usage Per Sec', 'Host CPU Utilization (%)', 'Network Traffic Volume Per Sec') AND lc1.dbid = sn.dbid AND lc1.instance_number = sn.instance_number AND sn.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) ORDER BY lc1.metric_name

SELECT RESOURCE_NAME , CURRENT_UTILIZATION , MAX_UTILIZATION , LIMIT_VALUE FROM DBA_HIST_RESOURCE_LIMIT lc1 , sys.dba_hist_snapshot sn WHERE lc1.snap_id = sn.snap_id AND TO_CHAR( sn.end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) = :SN_TIME AND lc1.dbid = sn.dbid AND lc1.instance_number = sn.instance_number AND sn.instance_number = ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ) AND CURRENT_UTILIZATION + MAX_UTILIZATION > 0 -- used resources only ORDER BY lc1.resource_name

SELECT * FROM TABLE(dbms_workload_repository.awr_report_html( ( SELECT dbid FROM v$database ), ( SELECT instance_number FROM v$instance ), ( SELECT MAX( snap_id ) FROM dba_hist_snapshot WHERE TO_CHAR( end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) < :SN_TIME ), -- Starting snapshot ( SELECT snap_id FROM dba_hist_snapshot WHERE TO_CHAR( end_interval_time, 'yyyy-mm-dd hh24:mi' ) = :SN_TIME ), -- Ending snapshot 0 -- Optionen (8 für ADDM-Bericht) ))
